translation: upokorzenie, poniżenie [the act of making someone seem less important or less deserving of respect]
sentence: Slaves were subject to a life of degradation and abasement.

translation: tajemny, nieprzenikniony [formal; mysterious and known only by a few people]
sentence: He was the only person who understood all the arcane details of the agreement.

translation: przebiegły, umiejętny [clever and skilful, especially in getting what you want]
sentence: He has shown himself to be an artful politician.

translation: mrugać [to close and open the eyes quickly, once or several times]
sentence: He stared at us without blinking.

translation: plama, krosta [a mark that is not regular in shape, for example on a person's skin]
sentence: Her face was covered in purple blotches.

translation: rozmyślać, dumać [to think a lot about something that makes you annoyed, anxious, or upset]
sentence: You're not still brooding over what he said, are you?

translation: goździk [(a plant with) a small flower with a sweet smell, usually white, pink, or red in color]
sentence: He was wearing a carnation in his buttonhole.

translation: sutanna [a long, loose, usually black piece of clothing worn especially by priests]
sentence: He is rarely seen without a thick beard, and performs in an all black cassock.

translation: lepki [sticky and slightly wet in an unpleasant way]
sentence: My hands felt all clammy.

translation: punkt kulminacyjny [the most important or exciting point in a story or situation, especially when this happens near the end]
sentence: The election campaign reaches its climax next week.

translation: konwersacja [formal; a formal conversation]
sentence: In the cave the saint held his famous colloquy with the devil, in which Satan was worsted and contemptuously dismissed.

translation: zadziwiać, wprawiać w zakłopotanie [to confuse and very much surprise someone, so that they are unable to explain or deal with a situation]
sentence: The singer confounded her critics with a remarkable follow-up album.

translation: drzewo iglaste
sentence: A mixed forest of deciduous and conifer trees formed a dense covering of mottled greens.

translation: zatoczka [a curved part of a coast that partly surrounds an area of water]
sentence: The coastline has steep cliffs, gigantic sea caves, coves, and sandy beaches.

translation: potępiać [formal; to criticize something as bad, without value, or unnecessary]
sentence: Lawyers decried the imprisonment of several journalists.

translation: czyn, uczynek [formal; an intentional act, especially a very bad or very good one]
sentence: It seems to me that a lot of evil deeds are done in the name of religion.

translation: obłąkany, szalony [unable to think or act clearly because you are extremely worried, angry, or excited by something]
sentence: She was nearly demented with worry when her son didn't come home.

translation: szyderczy [formal; unkind and showing that you think someone or something is ridiculous]
sentence: She gave a short, derisive laugh.

translation: niepokojący, zawstydzający [making someone feel uncertain and uncomfortable or worried]
sentence: His message is deeply disconcerting for anyone who values democracy.

translation: niezgoda, zgrzyt [formal; the state of not agreeing or sharing opinions]
sentence: The plan to build the highway created discord in our community.

translation: opowiadać się za, wyznawać [formal; to become involved with or support an activity or opinion]
sentence: They espoused the notion of equal opportunity for all in education.

translation: wyraźnie [formal; in a way that is clear]
sentence: I expressly told you to be home by midnight.

translation: straszydło [an unpleasant or ugly sight in a public place]
sentence: They think the new library building is an eyesore.

translation: wymachiwać [(especially of arms and legs) to move energetically in an uncontrolled way]
sentence: A wasp came towards us and Howard started flailing his arms around.

translation: krzemień [(a piece of) shiny grey or black stone that is like glass; stone or metal used in a musket to make it fire or in a cigarette lighter to produce a flame]
sentence: Scraping the striker down the flint generates a spark three times as hot as a standard match to ignite easily any dry tinder material.

translation: pozłacany [covered with a thin layer of gold or a substance that looks like gold]
sentence: The gilded dome of the cathedral rises above the city.

translation: wygadany, gładki [(of speakers and speech) using words in an easy and smooth way but without much thought, and usually not sincere]
sentence: No one was convinced by his glib explanations.

translation: nienawiść [an extremely strong feeling of dislike]
sentence: What is very clear in these letters is Clark's passionate hatred of his father.

translation: uparty, zawzięty [very determined to do what you want without listening to others]
sentence: She was a headstrong child, always getting into trouble.

translation: serdecznie [enthusiastically, energetically, and often loudly]
sentence: She laughed heartily at the joke.

translation: scheda, dziedzictwo [a valuable object that has been given by older members of a family to younger members of the same family over many years]
sentence: This ring is a family heirloom.

translation: ograniczony, zacofany [having fixed opinions and ways of doing things and not willing to change or be influenced, especially by new or modern ideas]
sentence: She wanted a life that was less hidebound by rules and conventions.

translation: niezaprzeczalny, bezsporny [formal; impossible to doubt because of being obviously true]
sentence: Her logic is utterly incontrovertible.

translation: akt oskarżenia [a formal statement of accusing someone]
sentence: The charges on the indictment include murder and attempted murder.

translation: aluzja, insynuacja, podtekst seksualny [(the making of) a remark or remarks that suggest something sexual or something unpleasant but do not refer to it directly]
sentence: There's always an element of sexual innuendo in our conversations.

translation: zestawiać ze sobą [to put things that are not similar next to each other]
sentence: The exhibition juxtaposes Picasso's early drawings with some of his later works.

translation: żmudny, pracochłonny [taking a lot of time and effort]
sentence: Checking all the information will be slow and laborious.

translation: toaleta [informal; UK; toilet]
sentence: I'll just go to the loo.

translation: mleczko, balsam [a liquid that you put on your skin in order to protect it, improve its condition, or make it smell pleasant]
sentence: She smeared sun tan lotion all over herself.

translation: fosa [a long, wide hole that is dug all the way around a place such as a castle and usually filled with water, to make it more difficult to attack]
sentence: The seven-metre-high wall that enclosed the dockyards was surrounded by a deep and wide moat.

translation: klasztor [a building in which monks live and worship]
sentence: Women are not allowed to enter the monastery for historical reasons.

translation: niepamięć, zapomnienie [the state of being completely forgotten]
sentence: He was another minor poet who was consigned to oblivion.

translation: wybuch, poryw, przypływ [a sudden forceful expression of emotion, especially anger]
sentence: Her comments provoked an outburst of anger from the boss.

translation: szyba [a flat piece of glass, used in a window or door]
sentence: It's a huge window made from a single pane of glass.

translation: stronniczy, uprzedzony [influenced by the fact that you personally prefer or approve of something, so that you do not judge fairly]
sentence: The reporting in the papers is entirely partial and makes no attempt to be objective.

translation: fragment, ustęp [a short piece of writing or music that is part of a larger piece of work]
sentence: Several passages from the book were printed in a national newspaper before it was published.

translation: zerkać, podglądać [to secretly look at something for a short time, usually through a hole]
sentence: We caught her peeping through the keyhole.

translation: zadumany, zamyślony [thinking deeply about something, especially because you are sad or worried]
sentence: She became withdrawn and pensive, hardly speaking to anyone.

translation: chlew [an enclosed area where pigs are kept]
sentence: Your bedroom is a pigpen!

translation: mały palec u dłoni [the smallest finger of the hand]
sentence: Take your middle finger, ring finger, and pinkie finger and place them on the long side of the deck.

translation: błagać, prosić, przyznawać się do winy [to make an urgent, emotional statement or request for something]
sentence: He was on his knees, pleading for mercy.

translation: spekulant, geszefciarz [disapproving; a person who takes advantage of a situation in which other people are suffering to make a profit, often by selling goods that are difficult to get at a high price]
sentence: Humanitarian aid such as cans of oil were resold by war profiteers.

translation: rozwlekły [formal disapproving; using too many words and therefore boring or difficult to read or listen to]
sentence: The author's prolix style has done nothing to encourage sales of the book.

translation: profilaktyczny [preventing disease]
sentence: Some dentists are convinced that the addition of fluoride in water is ineffective as a prophylactic treatment.

translation: drżeć [to shake slightly, often because of strong emotion]
sentence: Lennie's bottom lip quivered and tears started in his eyes.

translation: mieszkać, przebywać, rezydować [formal; to live, have your home, or stay in a place]
sentence: The family now resides in southern France.

translation: prowodyr [a person who leads others in crime or in causing trouble]
sentence: The ringleaders of the plot were arrested and punished.

translation: pewny siebie [approving; having confidence in your own abilities]
sentence: The interview showed her as a self-assured and mature student.

translation: lunatykować [to get out of bed and walk around while you are sleeping]
sentence: I sleepwalked when I was a child.

translation: łyk [informal; an amount of drink, especially strong alcoholic drink, that you can swallow at one time]
sentence: I had a slug of vodka to give me courage.

translation: breja, topniejący śnieg [snow that is lying on the ground and has started to melt]
sentence: The city’s streets were covered with dirty, gray slush.

translation: trzeźwosść [formal; the state of being sober]
sentence: The police said his car had been weaving all over the road, so they pulled him over and gave him a sobriety test.

translation: przestronny [(approving) (of a room or building) large and with plenty of space for people to move around in]
sentence: The hotel rooms are spacious and comfortable.

translation: zalotnik, pretendent [literary or old-fashioned; a man who wants to marry a particular woman]
sentence: It's the story of a young woman who can't make up her mind which of her many suitors she should marry.

translation: chwiać się, zataczać się [to walk with difficulty in a way that looks as if you are about to fall]
sentence: She tottered unsteadily down the stairs in her high-heeled shoes.

translation: gruźlica [a serious infectious disease that can attack many parts of a person's body, especially their lungs]
sentence: Moreover, infectious diseases, such as tuberculosis, affect the size of the labour force and the productive capacity of the economy.

translation: wymawiać, wypowiadać [formal; to say something or to make a sound with your voice]
sentence: She sat through the whole meeting without uttering a word.

translation: prawdziwość [formal; the quality of being true, honest, or accurate]
sentence: Doubts were cast on the veracity of her alibi.

translation: wypaczać, osłabiać [formal; to destroy or damage something]
sentence: He said that American military power should never again be vitiated by political concerns.

translation: machać, merdać [(especially of a tail or finger) to move from side to side or up and down, especially quickly and repeatedly, or to cause this to happen]
sentence: The little dog's tail wagged in delight.
